experience.summary: Leading a 12-person team across APAC, I oversaw the software development lifecycle, providing mentorship and technical direction, including system architecture design. I engineered and implemented critical financial systems, such as a payment request queue prioritization system boosting operational efficiency and automated credit schema functions enhancing security. I spearheaded the development of SEA wallets and products from architecture to integration, unified payment workflows, orchestrated ledger synchronization, and directed updates to scheduled payments. Key technical achievements included significantly improving debit account balance query performance for real-time data access and achieving notable API query performance enhancements, reducing response times. I also resolved data inconsistencies, refactored code for reliability, architected flexible scheduled payment solutions, and led the transition from a monolithic to a microservices architecture, enhancing scalability and maintainability across platforms.

experience.summary: Exercising top-down leadership aligned with company objectives, I effectively led and integrated diverse cross-functional engineering teams—DevOps, Infrastructure, Data, Frontend, Backend, and Support—fostering a culture of open communication, dependability, and accountability. I successfully grew the team significantly, managing operations efficiently across multiple time zones, primarily from Singapore. My focus on excellence in details drove critical performance optimization initiatives, dramatically reducing database query execution times from 3 seconds to 800 milliseconds and API calls from 2 seconds to 100 milliseconds, alongside implementing cloud cost optimization strategies. I collaborated directly with C-level executives to drive expansion and scale engineering efforts, ensuring seamless execution and high-quality results across all initiatives.
